zone.line: into a perpetual chaos.
I will not dwell longer than I need
on these disastrous circumstances. I might
waste days in describing to you how anxiously
I watched every change or fleeting circum
stance that promised better days, and with
what despair I found that each effort of
mine aggravated his seeming madness. To
tell you all my grief I might as well attempt
to count the tears that have fallen from
these eyes, or every sigh that has torn
my heart. I will be brief for there is a in
all this a horror that will not bear
many words, and I sink almost a second
time to death while I recall these sad
scenes to my memory. Oh, my beloved father!
Indeed you made me miserable beyond
all words, but how truly did I even then
forgive you, and how entirely did you
possess my ^whole heart while I endeavoured, as a
rainbow gleams upon a cataract, X to soften
thy tremendous sorrows.
Thus did this change come about.
I seem perhaps to have dashed too sudden
X Lord Byron.
